Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that a 32,000-year-old idol of Lord Narasimha was found in Germany.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the idol in the viral image is from Germany, which is incorrect.
Exist alternative explanation: The idol in the viral image is actually the Löwenmensch figurine from Germany, which is a different artifact than claimed.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the idol in the viral image is actually from the Upper Palaeolithic period, around 40,000 years ago, and is currently displayed in the Ulm Museum in Germany.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the age of the idol by stating it is 32,000 years old, while it is actually around 40,000 years old.
Understate: No instances of understating biases are evident in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting misleading information about the origin and age of the idol.
